title: MIBI-apply-model-nf pipeline parameters
description: Pipeline to apply a trained XGBoost model to unlabelled preprocessed QuPath data.

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Preprocessed input data file from QuPath. E.g., /home/users/allstaff/<username>/batch1-apply_preprocessed_input_data.csv

run_name.description: Run name used to label output files. E.g., batch1-apply.

model.description: Final model saved from training. E.g., /vast/scratch/users/<username>/mibi-batch1-workspace/batch1-training-logp1-SMOTE-1/final_model.sav

preprocess_scheme.description: The scheme used to preprocess the model before application. E.g., logp1

decoder_file.description: JSON file containing the decoder for the predicted cell types. E.g., /home/users/allstaff/<username>/batch1-apply_decoder.json

images_list.description: Path to CSV list of images produced during preprocessing. E.g., /home/users/allstaff/<username>/batch1-apply_images.csv

output_path.description: Path to directory to store output files. E.g., /home/users/allstaff/<username>/batch1-apply-results

options_file.description: TOML file containing preprocessing scheme and model classifier options. Only needed if --preprocess_scheme=poly. E.g., /home/users/allstaff/<username>/options.toml

threshold.description: Not sure what this does yet

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.
